protocol_name: Determining Genome Targeting Efficiency using T7 Endonuclease I (M0302)
protocol_name_html: Determining Genome Targeting Efficiency using T7 Endonuclease I (M0302)
description: T7 Endonuclease I recognizes and cleaves non-perfectly matched DNA. This protocol describes how to determine genome targeting efficiency by digesting annealed PCR products with T7 Endonuclease I. In the first step PCR products are produced from the genomic DNA of cells whose genomes were targeted using Cas9, TALEN, ZFN etc. In the second step, the PCR products are annealed and digested with T7 Endonuclease I. Fragments are analyzed to determine the efficiency of genome targeting.

materials.reagent_name: Q5 Hot Start High-Fidelity 2X Master Mix - 100 rxns

keywords: genomic targeting efficiency, genomic target, T7 Endonuclease for Gene targeting, determining genome targeting efficiency by digesting annealed PCR with T7 endonuclease, digest with T7 endonuclease I
guidelines:
Overview:

T7 Endonuclease I recognizes and cleaves non-perfectly matched DNA. This protocol describes how to determine genome targeting efficiency by digesting annealed PCR products with T7 Endonuclease I. In the first step PCR products are produced from the genomic DNA of cells whose genomes were targeted using Cas9, TALEN, ZFN etc. In the second step, the PCR products are annealed and digested with T7 Endonuclease I. Fragments are analyzed to determine the efficiency of genome targeting.

Required Materials:
  • Q5® Hot Start High-Fidelity 2X Master Mix (M0494S)
  • T7 Endonuclease I (M0302S)
  • 0.25 mM EDTA
  • Purified genomic DNA from targeted cells
  • PCR primers to amplify a ~1kb region containing the target site
  • The target site should be offset from the center of the amplicon so that digestion produces easily resolvable DNA fragments
  • PCR primer design is critical. Please visit NEB's Tools and Resources page to optimize your primer design using the NEB Tm Calculator
  • A PCR thermocycler with programmable temperature ramp rate
  • DNA purification system - we recommend Ampure XP beads
  • Apparatus to quantitate DNA - spectrophotometer or fluorometer
  • Apparatus to analyze DNA fragments – e.g. Agilent Bioanalyzer, Qiagen Qiaxel, or standard agarose gel electrophoresis

PCR

Cycling Conditions
Step Temperature Time
Initial Denaturation 98°C 30 seconds
35 cycles

 98°C 5 seconds
*50-72°C 10 seconds
72°C 20 seconds
Final Extension 72°C 2 minutes
Hold 4-10°C  
*Use of the NEB Tm Calculator is highly recommended.
Note: Q5 Hot Start High-Fidelity 2X Master Mix does not require a separate activation step. Standard Q5 cycling conditions are recommended.

T7 Endonuclease I digestion:

Anneal the PCR products in a thermocycler using the following conditions:
Hybridization Conditions
Step Temperature Ramp Rate Time
Initial Denaturation 95°C   5 minutes
Annealing  95-85°C -2°C/second  
85-25°C -0.1°C/second  
Hold 4°C   Hold

REFERENCES:
Guschin, D.Y., et. al.(2010) A rapid and general assay for monitoring endogenous gene modification. Methods Mol Biol, 649, 247–256.

components.data:
Set up a 50 µl PCR reaction using ~100 ng of genomic DNA as a template. For each amplicon set up 3 PCR reactions (positive, negative, no-template control)

Component 50 µl reaction Final Concentration
Q5® Hot Start High-Fidelity 2X Master Mix (M0494S) 25 µl 1X
10 µM Forward Primer 2.5 µl 0.5 µM
10 µM Reverse Primer 2.5 µl 0.5 µM
Template DNA variable 100 ng total
Nuclease-free water To 50 µl

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Determining Genome Targeting Efficiency using T7 Endonuclease I (M0302)
source_data.protocol_name: Determining Genome Targeting Efficiency using T7 Endonuclease I (M0302)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Determining Genome Targeting Efficiency using T7 Endonuclease I (M0302)
source_data.annotation:
For each amplicon set up 3 PCR reactions using the following templates:
- gDNA from targeted cells (e.g. Cas9, or TALEN transfected cells)
- gDNA from negative control cells (e.g. non-specific DNA transfected cells)
- water (i.e. no template control)
source_data.thread_text:
For each amplicon set up 3 PCR reactions using the following templates:
- gDNA from targeted cells (e.g. Cas9, or TALEN transfected cells)
- gDNA from negative control cells (e.g. non-specific DNA transfected cells)
- water (i.e. no template control)

- water (i.e. no template control)

components.data: Analyze the fragmented PCR products and determine the percent of nuclease-specific cleavage products (fraction cleaved)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Analyze the fragmented PCR products and determine the percent of nuclease-specific cleavage products (fraction cleaved)

components.data:
Calculate the estimated gene modification using the following formula: 
% gene modification = 100 x (1 – (1- fraction cleaved)1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Calculate the estimated gene modification using the following formula: 
% gene modification = 100 x (1 – (1- fraction cleaved)1/2)
